subject: Fashion
title: FOMO and Impulse Buying
description: One-minute skill: FOMO and Impulse Buying.

hook.text: 'Only 2 left!' That tiny message triggers a fear response that bypasses your rational brain.

buildup.text: FOMOâ€”fear of missing outâ€”is a proven driver of impulse buys, especially in online fashion shopping.

discovery.text: Countdown timers, limited drops, and low-stock alerts exploit scarcity bias, a deep evolutionary instinct.

twist.text: Most 'limited' stock isn't limited. Brands manufacture urgency to make you buy before you think.

climax.text: The rush of snagging a 'rare' deal fades fast. What remains is a closet full of things you didn't need.

punchline.text: Urgency is manufactured. The only real scarcity is your money.

quiz.question: Why do 'limited stock' warnings work so effectively on online shoppers?
options: They provide accurate inventory data that helps consumers make informed decisions
They trigger evolutionary scarcity bias, causing people to buy before thinking rationally
They are legally required by consumer protection agencies
